y8_5jtebJWslNbUocYRxWg.text: Went there for a second time recently. I liked it just as much as the first time. Tortillas are home made. I would highly recommend.

lvuJ10YkLMYLBZ7ufd8uig.text: Great vibes + great tacos = solid  I came in as a following to the amazing reviews and left with the need to leave my own 5-star review. I ordered both of their special tacos (al pastor and can't remember the name of the other but it was delicious; it had carne asada, cheese, caramelized onions, avo salsa) and their fish taco. The meat in all of tacos were cooked well, marinated well, and complimented all of the toppings perfectly. I loved that the fish wasn't too fried/oily for a breaded fish and loved the pickled veg on top. I would definitely come back if I came back to the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sp1UngXHtl5H0-jy0g_hCw.text: For me, this is the best taco spot in Phoenix area... quick service, delicious food, great drinks..... Highly recommended!!!! Thanks for the crew who cooks and serve to make this place worth 20 min drive every time!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne assada taco
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Oy-1pAMJnaoqFIwRoefeLw.text: Nestled in the busy, booming area of downtown Phoenix, Taco Chelo has so much potential. The restaurant itself has personality -  from the 'instagram-able' decor and lighting to the cool, spanish music blasting on the speakers. It is a charming restaurant well suited for date night, birthday dinners and the like. Unfortunately, that's about the best part about it.   It is a cafeteria-style restaurant, and the staff is extremely limited. We dined on a Friday night, and my sister waited more than 30 minutes for her tacos because the server accidentally took the wrong order number from our table. When I pointed out that she has been waiting a while,  they were gracious enough to give us free tacos which we appreciated.   The food was nothing spectacular and for how much I paid (3.75 a taco) I thought it would be well worth it. I had a few bites of my carne asada and carnitas tacos and didn't finish the rest of it. The fish tacos were probably the best out of all of them - delicious slaw and crispy, perfectly cooked fish. The corn tortillas were made in house from scratch. I had a moscow mule which was pretty pricey (around $12 I believe).  Overall, I probably would not come back.

KBH3hlaMe79LSoCVSjUhkg.text: I know exactly how spoiled I am when it comes to the tacos that are abundantly at my fingertips in Los Angeles, but I've been impressed by Phoenix tacos in the past and wanted to give them another run in the form of Chelo Tacos. In short, they were good, but they didn't blow me away.    Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  The service and atmosphere at Taco Chelo are divey but comfortable, and I was well taken care of at the bar. The menu is straight forward, and I had my three tacos out in no time. Star.      Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  I fully expect to pay a premium for non-street tacos at a sit down restaurant, but even so the price tags that ranged between $3.00 and $3.50 at Taco Chelo were slightly higher than I expected. Enough to go docking stars? No given these were slightly larger than normal tacos, but it was a close one. Star.     Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  As others have pointed out, the handmade tortillas at Taco Chelo are a huge plus, but even with those in play I was a bit let down ... until I had my carne asada taco.   I don't know what Taco Chelo does to this steak or where they get it from, but it was firmly on bar with some of the better barbecue I've had anywhere in the country. The unique smokey flavor was out of this world and came together brilliantly in a taco complimented by some of Taco Chelo's salsas. Single Star.     Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  Taco Chelo doesn't quite have the menu diversity nor the price points for me to make this my go-to PHX taco spot, but they're worth visiting for the tortillas and the carne asada. No Star.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos: $3-$3.50 each

lbIGg5ipxR59rhAEtGi9Bw.text: Horchata is amazing. Has the good gritty texture horchata should have. Salsas were good and fresh. Castra taco was AMAZING. Cute atmosphere too.

oDVFnFOVk-iB76rsu5SJ1w.text: Tacos Tacos Tacos. Yum, what a wonderful and unique place in Downtown Phoenix. I love coming here. The aguas frescas taste homemade. Salsas and guac are truly wonderful and the tacos themselves are spectacular.  The decor has to be my favorite part. There are touches of Latin American-Spanish culture. I love the poems and art work displayed throughout the restaurant. The staff is absolutely wonderful. This is a wonderful place to enjoy company and authentic food!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos Costas y un quesadilla

gBF2qMJdx1nHao8UqbXzyg.text: Good for a quick bite to eat.  We visited at 10pm and the place was packed. Even, as busy as it was we got our food quickly and the food was tastey and fresh  The staff were attentive. The autmosphere is pleaseant, the staff are friendly. The place is clean and well maintained. I'd recommend if you'd like a late night bite to eat or to meet with friends.

p5zSfcgXhKwqjaivtTHjmQ.text: Fun atmosphere, great drinks and tasty tacos! Plus its a hop and a skip away from home...how could I not love this?!  Pros: -Interior is open to the street view as well as the back patio. Get your people watching on! -Salsas are fantastic, bold and flavorful with an added kick -Michelada's on deck...don't forget the added shot of tequila (plus you get your can of beer with whatever is left) -Jacima & Hibiscus Margarita for the win! -Fish Tacos are to die for with the crema and pickled onions -Servers are well versed in the menu and more importantly their signature cocktails  Cons: -Pretty humid due to all doors/windows being open and the kitchen being exposed -Flys galore...enough to make you want to only drink -Limited patio seating with sun coverage

Z_RT-2JJcm7lIGkwf4vw8w.text: Came here on our visit to Phoenix. It is located around the art district of the town. It has a collage town bar feelings. Self service and cheap prices and collage town food quality. Service is nice and the restaurant is nice and clean. The drinks are OK but I think a bit pricey for the quality and quantity that you get. A lot of flys inside the restaurant but I guess with the open concept it is to be expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar at Taco Chelo

7FzWNeYW6oS4k480XOlKKQ.text: I came here for Taco Tuesday and they had $2 tacos! Which I thought was a fair price. The three you could choose from that day was carnitas, chicken, or steak with fried cheese. I ordered 1 chicken, and 2 steak with fried cheese.   The chicken had pico de gallo and cotija cheese. That one was okay. But the steak one was amazing! It was nice fajita style steak with melted cheese and a layer of fried cheese on top!  On the side they give you some cucumber slices and salsas, their red salsa tasted like it had a hint of bbq which went very well with the tacos.   It's definitely worth coming here on Taco Tuesday!

Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The 2 steak tacos with fried cheese and the chicken taco during Taco Tuesday.

6-EOGmpQOwwLT4s4qKVi8w.text: What's not to like? Great laid-back atmosphere. The food is incredibly fresh and tasty. Had the fish taco, barbacoa taco, carnitas taco, and the chips and salsa. The red salsa was flavorful and more seeet, the green was a really good heat. Negro Modelo topped it all off.  Order at the register, friendly staff.  Would definitely come here again.

8hICWxMqmWDNRgOBla-oUA.text: The food! The food! It's so good. I seriously think about this place regularly. It's so far from my house that I can't get there that often but it's one of my favorites! I've tried nearly everything on the menu and nothing disappoints.

l89aLqEbG-DSYjXzNJWJLw.text: I have heard nothing but good things from different sources about this place so I finally made the trip. Unfortunately it was not worth it. I tried the carne asada tacos and asada quesadilla. The meat was way over salted and had a burnt taste. In my opinions the salsa makes a taco. The salsas served here are basic and lack flavor. They make there own tortillas but that did not make up for the taste of the meat. The food really deserves 2 stars but the decor here is on point so I bumped it up a star. This would be a great place to have a few drinks and relax just don't plan on being amazed by the food.

HAZF-tE0drYDWcsizgzY3Q.text: Firt time authentic carne asada flavor.. Horchata water amazing..so delicious ..fish tacos great ..

-UmwvLs11Hqekcc9qY9law.text: We visited Taco Chelo last week and ordered a few of the pork tacos and barbacoa tacos.  Barbacoa, albeit the meat was cold, had good flavor.  Pork was also good, but overall it's not a meal I would find myself craving.  Salsas were great, and the margarita was excellent.  With all the hype, design, and work to have this place open in our neighborhood, I expected more on the menu.  You have $3.50 tacos, chips/salsa, and a couple other appetizer type foods that could rival a food truck - not a full service restaurant.  I can see us returning for happy hour and potentially a pre-dinner sort of situation.  If I want to have a real (full) meal, I've got a list of other places we can go visit for that.

sQwXRVSvQgZDYw6bedX_FA.text: Decent tacos. Amazing tortillas. I was not a fan of having to get up every time I wanted a drink, but I guess it's an interesting concept. The barbacoa is the best! Very friendly staff, and very good service. The place is modern, clean, very chic. White washed Mexican place, but it's pretty good. I would love it if they had a salsa bar!

5W2IMKlP1C5K7GWtNpdLcQ.text: The tacos were delicious and the service was great, but the price per taco is ridiculous. For a carne asada taco, it costed more than $3!! That's insane... I'm not expecting it to be like $1, but damn, $3? Atmosphere is nice and there's outside seating as well. Alcohol is also served at this location! It's near a barcade, so if you get the munchies, it's right around the block. :) Don't think I would come here again if I came back to Arizona; it's a little pricey, but worth the experience.

E4JJzcUfdDcNt5q2o4bdnw.text: I stopped in because the yelp reviews were good and I was not disappointed. I had the taco chelo salad with fish and it was great! I liked the different flavors and the dressing was very lime tasting which mixed well with the greens. The fish was crunchy and delicious. Since it was happy hour I also had a margarita which was also great. The people beside me had tacos and they looked so good, I will definitely go back the next time I'm in town.

2NfPUi0OuCRTd0SfAzWdDQ.text: I will start with Way Over Priced. I'm a neighbor of theirs and I was happy to see a new restaurant move into the neighborhood. And I'm a big supporter of my neighborhood. I gave them a try after they had time to open and work out some of the normal new restaurant bugs. I was still unexpressed with the product and service. And I thought the prices were too high for what I got. So I gave it a couple months and tried again. Still no change in service, product or prices. I tried a drink from the bar and I wondered if there was any liquor in it. I asked my friend and she thought the same. Recently as the weather got better, they started having live music. Again I'm a big supporter of the neighborhood and I know what it means to live downtown... But, the music needs to stop at 11pm. Those of us who live and work downtown, need to sleep. I called the restaurant and asked them to at least turn it down. The guy whom I spoke with said he would. Then it seemed to get louder. So thanks for the big middle finger Taco Chelo! Please be a good neighbor. The rest of your neighbors are trying real hard to support you.

uOmK8mHc8zPPjBwdVBn8EA.text: A small venue with a superb vibe. Great music and plenty of lively conversation and laughter all around. The aromas, flavors, and textures of the tacos burst with character.

3vOceA_GygU5gNFVpkQ9ZA.text: The food is good, not great. The wait to get the tacos is horrible. No side salsa and for such a expensive taco they are skimpy with the meat!! Look at all that extra tortilla.

2N8kSu6RLbBms97W7l9xdg.text: Really cool interior and location   I got the carne asada, carnitas, and fish taco. All good!  You have to order up front while waiting you can't miss the ladies making fresh tortillas and chips.   They were out of Barbacoa . Damnit !  The fresh tortilla chips with guacamole and salsa was the best part,  not saying everything else was not good but sometimes the simple things can really excel.

RNKdvXsmmNGctmlS-l8YZA.text: Okay so I've been here twice now and of course the handmade corn tortillas are amazing (like seriously, that's what sets this place apart) but what really got me was the green salsa.... O.M.G.... it is amazing! A little on the spicy side but it has a noticeable hint of lime that helped ease the sting.. soooo good! Reminds me of my Momma's green salsa! The carne asada quesadilla is amazing! Everything is cheap and soooo yummy!

9DYAxF866OBPNLiWY6LJAA.text: I had barbacoa, steak and fish tacos, my favorite one was the steak one, the barbacoa one was my second fave.  On the fish one I'll say it needed a little something, not sure what.  Their corn tortillas I thought we're pretty good.   This place gets five stars cause the staff was really nice, the food overall was pretty good and they delivered the food fast.  Coming back to try their frijoles a la charra and their tres leches.

3j-1oX3bOxBZ6a3kfRuHgw.text: Aioooooght.  Don't have too much negative to say about this place. I enjoyed their tacos. Although, I really don't like when establishments put certain seafood products in their Micheladas... some people have allergies or eat biblically.   May come back one day.

Ea7Blu3GeUcomMpRpEDjgg.text: Me and my friend decided to explore dt Phoenix last night and walked on this place. It was busy at 8:00 p.m., so we had to try. There is great outdoor area and indoor is awesome. It has great lighting with cool decor. The bar area is nice. You can order your food and watch a game. We ordered a couple of margaritas on rocks for $6 and they were absolutely great. Bartender Kitty was very helpful and made those drinks delicious. My friend also got Mezcal mixed drink from the menu and he loved it too. The chips with salsas and guacamole were super fresh and crunchy. I wanted to take them home We ordered fish and carnitas tacos which were good. I only wish that they would have other tortillas because I don't like regular store brand corn tortillas. Also, this place is straw free! I love that!

wKWG2ZV-WWX5FJQwwpPMlg.text: This place is awesome. My girlfriend and I went there last night for dinner and already want to go back for more. It is very reasonably priced and the food is delicious. They make their tortillas right there in front of you as you wait in line to order.

YeSz8rJB3BS76ldZCe2hyQ.text: Awesome place! Great casual atmosphere, and terrific happy hour. Tacos are top notch and the service is excellent. Stopped here on our return from Sedona to Tahoe. Suggest all do the same- really worthwhile.   Hint- park on the side street safe and free!

G0OMn7m2Q6383FG6Ew4H1g.text: Love the vibes. I had carne asada and fish tacos and was very impressed. Their micheladas are amazing!

71uPuhIVQbYHZfIsqqtjuA.text: So the food is good, but the service continues to be an issue. This last time, all the water jugs (self service) were empty. Several folks including me, asked they be refilled. The response was , we'll get to it when we have time. Yet, the cashier had time to run out and hug a friend, chat with friend, all the while the water remained empty. I probably will just go to Paz. I live in the neighborhood and want this place to do well, but the staff is not helpful at all and there are too many other choices. I never write negative reviews, but tonight was a clear example of what has always been mediocre service.

TUw-7KI30u2QYsDr9Q_rQQ.text: Awesome vibe and good tacos. I had the carne asada, carnitas and fish tacos. By far the carnitas tacos were the best. Nice and juice and flavored well.

sbezGD5Joj6Q-4hVABaTHg.text: I love this place!  Celebrated my birthday here a few months ago with some co workers and the vibe and atmosphere were perfect.  We ordered a variety of tacos, all of which were so tasty!!!  I also had a few margaritas and those were bomb.  Prices are reasonable.  Customer service was great.  This is definitely a place to check out.

cMRbuALnr7qyiBEjyZgwcw.text: Good food but WAAAYYY too expensive for what you are getting. For $3 you can get 1 taco that consists of a tortilla and steak bits. That's it. The fish taco were a little more expensive but worth it. A side of chips was $3 which I think was not worth the cost for a small bag of chips.

YIXvPe5IQ7LXVOpPZFmK4A.text: Stopped in during their soft opening.  Great fresh food. Friendly service.  Fun atmosphere.  Best of luck to the owners & staff.

BN3IQaItrdny4RErZJm2-Q.text: The tacos are great and the atmosphere is also great.  This is a great alternative to places like Joyride and the like.  The only reason I didn't give the 5 stars is because they don't offer free refills on the aguas frescas.

wwa2VoHjWg38UGPVECXvxA.text: Portions are small but are well worth the price. Get the carne asada & fish tacos with chips, guac & salsa. Worth every cent.

tsr9SxfNvpNKQT1fx3LRfw.text: Stopped in late at night. The atmosphere was relaxed, not very busy for the unsatisfactory service we received. The food was decent, but the two male bartender/servers were not so friendly and the rest of the staff seemed to be the same. After ordering, we weren't checked in on, my cup was empty and not once were we asked by any waitress or bartender if we'd like a refill. We waited about another 30 min for them to give us the bill. Very disappointed in a place we were looking forward to coming to.

S7-38Aq07kg-AppG8OHNJg.text: Like the vibe enjoyed the tacos and the Nehru modelos. Cool spot has a nice open feel had two Barbacoa tacos were tasty. This place is around the corner for me and open most of the time so a good little break in the middle of the day spot

9JzmZiEiqXbThwe_CvrZiA.text: This taqueria is dope! They brought the Mexican street tacos into an art gallery. The asada and barbacoa tacos are really good - the tortillas hecho a mano is an excellent touch.

7xbzQ5N_AEPGGybV9-1qDg.text: was really excited to try a new mexican spot in downtown phoenix. but when i arrived restaurant was CLOSED. it was only 4pm. site says open till 10pm.

0KOBbnE_8XcLQSrgl50nFg.text: Visited Taco Chelo for the first time today for lunch. These were the best fish tacos I've had in a very long time. The fish is light and super fresh, covered in a delicious beer batter. The toppings - including a cream sauce, cabbage, pico de gallo and pickled onions - are to die for! The tacos have the perfect amount of spice and a generous portion of fish. The corn taco shells are fresh and soft - you can see them making them fresh in the back. I can't wait to go again and bring my friends.

HdZvDis_uDJtMtCLEoi_Jg.text: Hands down the best taco shop in Phoenix period. The best part of these tacos is that the tortillas are hand made fresh literally when they are preparing your food. The seasoning in the carnitas is perfect and the meat is not dry or to moist. The carne asada and the barbacoa tacos are amazing as well. I am super stoked that there is an amazing taco joint in Phx that way I don't miss my native country. One of the owners is an artist as well and the are hanging in the walls as well as the one painted on one of the walls is awesome. This is place is a must if you love tacos and either I've in Phx or is visiting Phx. The food the ambiance and the art makes this place an amazing experience. I bring all of my friends and family when they come in town and there's not a single time that they have left unhappy. BEST TACO SHOP IN PHX HANDS DOWN!!!

EEs3A06oIYZraKC5GSvgKw.text: Flavorless. Chips overcooked. Tasted like a lower quality of meat than what I'm used to.   Would never go back for food - place looked cool for drinks though.

u-IFz8lfrycQefEwnboh0g.text: Came here for a few hours after work on a Friday with a friend and had a great time! There were $5 margaritas and cheap tacos around $3 each so I definitely recommend this spot if you don't want to break the bank. The music playing was actual Cumbia/Reaggaeton which I loved and the ambiance of the restaurant was casual, dim lit, and started to pick up as the night went on. A manager came up to my friend and I with free shots of a local tequila new to Phoenix and the staff was also very friendly. You could stay a while at this spot, or just as easily be in and out depending on your schedule.

qMrs0A264bM88iJwcGkmWQ.text: Bland & tasteless fish tacos. They looked like they had potential but after the first bite I was so sad and just forced them down because I was starving. So disappointing. I might return and try something different bec it's a cute spot.

9PHjhHSUEY1RVCkz2LC0xg.text: I first heard of this place thanks to a PBS show called plate and pour. My bf and I love tacos, we are lucky to live so close to our favorite taco spot. We were planning on being at downtown phx on Tues so decided to have dinner here. what a perfect day because Taco Tuesday! I really wanted to like this place, I was really looking forward to trying their chicharron. I had told a coworker about this place who tried it before me and told me yes the chicharrons are delicious. We ordered the taco specials, carnitas and chicken. For me the carnitas were a little too salty for my taste but the Salas sort of balanced that out. The quesadilla was delicious. We also ordered house margaritas which were good, just a little too much salt on the rim. We received our drinks, then our taco, then I waited for my chicharron. Waitress came by and asked if there is anything we were waiting on I said yes an order of chicharron, she said she'll bring it right out. Then I waited, and waited and waited... I was so bummed and disappointed. The same waitress passed us about 4x with other people's food. We had a timed meter so after 45min of waiting for my chicharron I finally got up and asked if I can have that money go towards 2 beers. However even that was a wait and the cashier never gave me a number she just said she'll bring it out. And we waited another 15min for our drinks and had to go put more quarters in the meter. Over all nice place, seems like a great spot for an after work dinner or lunch. I hope for better service next time. I am still eager to taste those chicharron.

q9viJ9WSRAcYwzA_63se5A.text: It is a great place to get some authentic southern Mexico tacos, specially the carnitas tacos, they will not disappoint you. The hand made corn tortillas are one of a kind in Phoenix, I have not tasted nothing like it in the area.

so3JNmYOYIzgcDf331DBWg.text: Tacos are delicious, drinks are yummy!! The service is great as well as the location. This is definitely my go to place. The music is always on point!

TfhS-GAVCuoiGYbE2maxCA.text: The food is not the greatest.  The price is not so good.  The space is pretty cool, looked like the Bar was nifty.  I am a bit to thrifty, so I will say this place is not so nifty.  I will get my taco Tuesday fix at a different spot.

myJnZ0lF987dSsl649eCyw.text: Small portion sizes. Decent food, not really authentic but caters to (wealthy) millennials.

RQco7CLdBgMoJ647bEeGvA.text: Ambiance was decent. Decor was great! Food was okay. Not MY favorite tacos. The handmade homemade tortillas were GREAT!

WmFtEd35_ZBpE13enlvq1w.text: The best tacos in downtown Phx! Yummy, full of flavor, and very satisfying. Love the decor, and perfect location. Can't go wrong with giving this place a try. Staff was friendly as well. You can't go wrong with any of the tacos here!

t1nu0Qmc5_NJVBBJvOeofg.text: Expensive tacos but I'm used to the cheap ghetto side for tacos. Not quite as authentic as the tacos in the "hood" but they do satisfy my taco cravings now that I live nearby and I can taste the quality. The decor is awesome with paintings/portraits by local artists who are selling their stuff. They have a large bar and patio area. The menu is simple but I like that I'm not flipping through pages to find something. The staff is attentive and I love the tortillas they use. My favorite are the barbacoa tacos. Support local business and give this place a try!

Uy5CFTXB1G04ovfw2AGMeg.text: I cane in here at 11:45 and I wanted one drink, the girl at the register said they were closing at 12 but their hours say 2am. I definitely would have been gone before 12 but clearly they don't want my business, mind you not I live across at the broastone and saw plenty of people still ordering food!! Her attitude sucked and I definitely will not be back!! The bartender was willing to serve but she came over and said NO!! Horrible hospitality!!

1cqkTuI6qzkkCUdTnhY--A.text: One star for service so bad we didn't even get to eat.  Went in because it was a late Sunday dinner and per the reviews they are open late and have good food.  We walked in and there was no where to sit.  It's cold out so sitting outside was out of the question.  The staff just stared at us. Didn't welcome us in or apologize for not being able to accommodate us at the moment. We stood there and waited for about 10 mins then left.

brCboLiMobPEKraV2yFUHg.text: Better tacos than LA. I had the barbacoa and a Taco Chelo Salad. Superb. Everything about this place delivers; from the handmade tender tortillas to the spot on tlaquepaque sauce to the 5 star hospitable service. I am making the six hour drive from LA again. It is that worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Came from LA and wanted to compare Phoenix tacos to LA tacos. Hate to say it but the tacos at Taco Chelo rule.

hPLdQZI-7zboQ927mGCtRg.text: Experience: A foodies aesthetic dreams! From the modern frida khaki pictures to cool led lighting, the place is VIBRANT and filled with picture perfect decor! I enjoyed laughter and a open space both indoor and outdoor.   Drinks: I was quite happy with the options of Jarritos! They also had other drink options ranging from alcoholic, to non alcohol like horchata, and even agua freska. I really want to try their horchata and agua freska next time!   Food: The fish tacos... GET IT! The perfect balance between a savory batter and a drizzle of sour lemon squeeze!!! The tortilla wasn't soggy and tasted warm and fresh! My friends loved the vegetarian tacos, so I deff want to try them next time. For meat eaters, they have that option too.   Would I go back: So the place was a bit pricy for single tacos, but I'd still consider going back because of the ambiance and tacos.

fpLT4WOWgPYWRJ7acDuZDg.text: The worst taco restaurant I have ever been to. Taco Bell is better.

SuvmQZGVuxANeOhdGLT9Cw.text: So I walked into this spot on accident/unplanned because I meant to eat else where. I thought it was going to be like all the other taco joints but it wasn't! Service was the best I had ever had with taco joints!! Walked in looking unsure and stood for a minute to collect my thoughts, the bartender Missy, came up so welcoming and explained how things work here. After that I couldn't resist and found a spot at the bar where you get full service. If your at the tables, you'll order at counter and then get served drinks and food. I came in at the right time for happy hour (3pm- 6pm) & had food also which isn't on the HH menu but it was already at a reasonable price. Drinks were served timely, just like food. Both were great! Love how simple the menu is and you must get their Michelada, along with Carne Asada Tacos...such a great combo. The Manager Adrian is a great leader, he held a smile and great vibes for the whole time I was there...he also has great skills if you ever drop your EarPod in a tight spot. With a great boss there's great employees, thus why Missy is the bestest. She kept great rapport and suggested great things to do around Arizona. Go in and enjoy like I did!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Food
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Second $5 margarita, so good and definitely will get more!!

zH1VutqglmJPSvShRl07vg.text: Came here for lunch with a friend. We arrived at 1:00pm and were able to get a table inside. It has a nice interior and a patio in the back that would be great during cooler weather. I was greeted promptly and advised of how to order. You stand in line at the register and place your order and they give you a number and bring your food to the table. I'm not a real big fan of this style of ordering but the process did seem to go quickly. Since I was waiting on my friend I decided to order the chips/salsa/guacamole for $3.50. It was okay however I really wished there had been more guacamole. The salsas had a good flavor and none of them seemed to be really spicy. I ordered 3 tacos as I knew from reading the previous reviews that they were small. I probably would have been fine with just 2 (since I had been snacking on the chips) but I couldn't decide on which ones so I went ahead and went for 3. I ordered the fish, the carnitas, and the carne asada.  All are served with the traditional onions, cilantro, and limes. Hands down my favorite was the carnitas. I just wish there had been more meat in it. The little tablespoon or so just didn't fill up the corn tortilla it was in. The fish was okay but just had too much breading in my opinion. I prefer my fish tacos grilled and unfortunately they do not offer that option. And the carne asada had a good flavor but unfortunately I encountered a giant piece of fat/gristle in my 2nd bite of it and it kind of ruined it for me after that. They only serve bottled soft drinks and bottled iced tea (Pure Leaf) and if you want to add sweetener to your iced tea then you have to make do with their simple syrup from the bar which I despise. So at this point I doubt I will be back anytime soon as I thought the prices for each of the tacos was pretty steep ($3.50-$3.75 each) and I can think of a lot of other places to get street tacos at a better price.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish, Carne Asada, and Carnitas
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish, Vegetable
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips, Salsas, and Guacamole

lj4M8O6_NbZfp1ABfZ_baw.text: Great atmosphere and vibe at this new taco restaurant. I was happy to try it and since it's still new, they have a couple of kinks to work out. The line was out the door (to be expected- Friday evening AND it's a new restaurant) but we were able to snag a seat shortly after ordering. Drinks are a bit over priced in my opinion (canned Arizona sweet tea). Employees were friendly and attentive. I would recommend telling servers that it's not wise to tell a customer NOT to order something because of the assumed wait (fish tacos). I don't eat pork or beef and came there specifically for fish tacos hehe. We ordered 5 of them plus veggie tacos and they all came out rather quickly. They were very delicious! Would've missed out had I listened to the server (I'm sure she meant no harm) ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos +Veggie tacos+Veggie quesadilla

1_XF0uYpJPrRXQAXkLlLXA.text: Service was good. Love the atmosphere. I had a margarita, a carne asada taco and a fish taco :( . There was more breading than fish and it was very greasy. Was disappointed as the server said they are known for their tacos. I'd come back for a drink. Yes

iWFm8vU0JEgBSef1Cz61qg.text: I absolutely am in love with this place. The concept is a sit down restaurant, however, you go to a counter at the back of the restaurant to place your order for wonderful specials (they were making tres leches last time I was in), chips with salsa and quac (classic), bomb ass tacos (smaller/serval bits tacos) and dranks on dranks.  So far the sangria has been my favorite. The sangria is sweet enough but not overall sweet. You can also order food if you sit at the bar instead of getting in line for food (lines can take a while during prime time).   Overall decor is colorful and modern with an awesome painting near the bar/large window area in front. The bar is an awesome place to sit for a while and grab a drink or food. For those interested, there is also a tv.  Food - awesome but tacos are slightly small. Decor - modern, fun and flirty Dranks - derriosiois Happy hour - hellll yeah EVERYDAY 3-6 (includes $ margs and sangria) Service - nothing by friendly and helpful  PS Bathroom is not in the same building as the restaurant (you need a key and it's a build over on the back that's connected by an alley)

VnnXX8sBborYjvnlMgsQew.text: The taco costra was probably the best taco I've ever had!! Could have eaten 2 more!! Will be back very soon-if I ever leave!

Xqi_jjgzuHi1OmUSdAsouQ.text: We never dined at Taco Chelo's and decided to stop in to give it a try for dinner. These were some of the best tacos we've ever eaten. We had fish, carnitas and barbacoa tacos along with some chips and salsa. Fish tacos were cooked perfectly, with tasty toppings, radish lime and a mayo based smooth sauce. Really good!!!  Carnitas were also really good with onion and cilantro. Pork was super tender. But the star of our taco feast, hands down, was the barbacoa beef taco. This 2 day slow cooked beef melted in your mouth. And so flavorful with a slight kick of heat. This was the best taco I've ever had. Nice surroundings and super friendly help.

SZacMhHMadmU0tPpFUbORA.text: Delicious tacos/margaritas and extremely fast service! There was a lady behind the counter making fresh tortillas which came out warm. Veggie tacos were great and spicy with mushrooms, zucchini and beans inside. Perfect place to grab a bite to eat and drink on a Friday or Saturday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable &amp; fish tacos

tyQQhIoSknMfXjA56d71hg.text: A little Mexican restaurant located in the Roosevelt district. The space offers both indoor and outdoor seating. Seating is on the smaller side inside and they have the large style picnic tables outside. With the warm weather coming up it would be nice if there were some covers to block the sun and make it  less hot if dining outside. With that being said, the restaurant is counter service. The menu is pretty simple. They offer a few appetizers, street style tacos and salads. My husband and I ordered two fish tacos, two carne asada, cheese quesadilla, side of beans and chicharones. I thought the tacos lacked flavor and it was a bit on the bland side , but they weren't bad. It just didn't have that wow factor. The price of the tacos weren't to bad but I don't think it was worth 3.50. However the mini quesadilla we ordered was definitely not worth $2 . I did enjoy my pineapple Fresca. It was refreshing and not overly sweet.  The one thing I didn't enjoy was all the flies inside. Since they do leave the door open, there were so many flies and it was annoying trying to shoo the flies away while you ate. On the plus side, staff was friendly and service is fast . Your food comes out fast and it's nice not having to wait long to get your food. If you're looking for a quick bite then this is the place, but if you're wanting to sit down and dine, I would suggest going elsewhere. The foo

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. chicharones

LEP9EjGohehYpk1k-Uawew.text: Great taco joint. Authentic options with great salsas. Outdoor patio was very laid back. Not upscale but food is by far some of the best tacos I've ever had, and I've had a lot of tacos in a lot of places. If I'm the ballpark area of Phoenix pop in and check out their barbacoa and al pastor tacos, you won't be disappointed!

ugvE9sk9xcjifwKiToIHFg.text: The barbacoa and carnitas tacos were good.  But not $3.50 good.  The tacos can be finished in 3-4 bites at most, are not filling at all, and really add up price-wise.  I ordered three tacos and a quesadilla, ate all of it, and left very unsatisfied and still hungry.  Not to mention my meal cost upwards of $15.   I will not be returning.  There are far better taco joints in Phoenix that cost less and are much more satisfying (shout out Tacos Chiwas & Los Taquitos).

0iOHieMSBkCg4-FkZ-4GPA.text: We stopped in here for a late lunch, they did not disappoint!  Everything is fresh and scratch made!  I could eat an entire basket of their fresh corn tortillas (made to order).  We started with chips & guac along with the Frijoles A La Charra - do yourself a favor and order those beans .  We then ordered the fish, carnitas, & chicken (special).  I cannot say which was the best, they were all amazing!  We are already talking about when we r can come back!!!

VDj4XYd1Vl1rD50DFsobiQ.text: I came in here with high hopes that this was going to be my go to taco shop and although the tacos are decent 6.76/10 the price for them suck. If they were at a decent price I'd go back but they are all small portions and don't ask for guacamole because the portion size is sample

EUQ6D89BGNA5WLEyRI6EJw.text: I wish I loved this place. I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. It has a great vibe and decor but the tacos were just ok to good. In a town with amazing tacos around its hard to justify coming back. Kudos for the environmentally friendly dishware and "plastic ware".

AtC5f6NmMocf33NYQfHUTg.text: Great place. First time here even though I go to school down the street and decided to stop by today. Service was great, food was even better. I definitely recommend this place and will be back!!

oDMSRbkCnYtTh64VsXmPYg.text: Wow! Is all I can say. I was a guest last night and had the best experience! First, I loved the decor and the vibe was on point for a Tuesday night. The music was great and staff was very friendly and fun. This is the place to be if you are craving Mexican food and Latino music! The chips, salsa and guac was yummy too! There Are healthy food options too, which I like. I surely will be back!

cQsV20yUelFmxSA2bxqtig.text: Stopped by after a coworker mentioned a new spot near our office. For the sake of having tacos on a Tuesday we went. No specials, but a normal menu offering tacos and appetizers. Tried the Asada, Carnitas and Barbacoa tacos. The corn tortillas are freshly made and are on point. We tried two appetizers: chicharrones and frijoles a la charra.   Let's start with the tacos. Priced at $3+ they didn't come with enough meat and looked bare. The meats were ok but did not taste different in any way to have them stand out. The frijoles were missing something but were good, probably should have put them on the tacos to fill them. The chicharrons were good, extra crispy.   Would I come back? Maybe in a couple months see if they change it up or something.  Decor inside is legit and on o

u0QPsLqEbLiQHP_Nt3F34A.text: I was pretty excited to try this place out! Food was good, had the carne asada taco, a quesadilla with carne, and the barbacoa taco. Also chips and guacamole. Smallish portions but everything was there. Salsas were great! Seemed a bit pricey, but daily HH on drinks is always appreciated. The ordering situation was a little different at first, and I prefer full service, but that's that.  Great music + atmosphere!

2Y5-y4d_IjMUbkXNXVZOkw.text: This is one of the best taco shops in Phoenix! They have authentic Mexican street tacos and not over priced. You walk up to the counter and order. Then your food is served at your table. While you wait you can see all the beautiful work by local artist Gennaro Garcia. You can also see the tortillas being made by hand and the chefs cutting the meat.  My favorite tacos are the fish and veggie. The quesadillas were also delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XjslvAzkU6gCp_KefSwtNg.text: Really tasty tacos. Went on Taco Tuesday. A bit disappointed that there wasn't a special. I ordered three tacos (fish, carnitas, steak). The tacos here are definitely more substantial than the taco trucks in Seattle I am familiar with and given they are twice as expensive, that's a good thing. All the tacos were good but now that I tried them, my favorite is definitely the fish taco and I would just order a bunch of those. Three is pretty decent for average appetite, but I think most should order an appetizer too, if not another taco...

mDpRrf_zl4VzJJMba_LwGQ.text: Came in on a Tuesday night expecting taco Tuesday deals, but were disappointed since they don't have any extra specials on Tuesday's. We decided to just try a taco each and drinks. We ended up splitting a chips, salsa and guacamole order for the table. The chips were actually very good, crispy and fresh without being overly greasy. The guacamole was good too, a plus since there were no onions in it because I hate onions. The salsa was decent, spicy and it was also the same salsa that accompanied our tacos that arrived shortly thereafter. I got a carne asada taco which I was pleasantly surprised with. The tortilla was sturdy and flavorful amongst all the carne asada and there  as avocado garnishing the top, once again without onions! Our drinks took a long time to arrive, but once they did they were good. I got the margarita, a good balance between salty and sweet. Not watered down either. Overall it was a pleasant meal, albeit a little pricy for regular tacos even on a taco Tuesday. We were disappointed they didn't do any taco Tuesday deals, hopefully they may change their ways in the future.

Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They have a lot of Freida Kahlo paintings up inside
Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bad lighting, but the chips + salsa + guacamole appetizer

T17ZctDiFrY2W6ScPzs3KA.text: Authentic Mexican street tacos which take me back to the streets of Saluita Mexico after a day on the surf.  The corn tortillas are fresh, soft and thick; salsas on point; meats flavorful.  My only two minor complaints, the carnitas just a little too authentic, i.e. too many pieces of fat in the meat mix for my taste.  2. Not enough guacamole with the chips.  Otherwise 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Chelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great flavors on the chips, guacamole and salsa.  Get extra guacamole.

GxpT5E46G0kixmr5NVsDrw.text: Great ambiance and friendly staff. Had I not known you order at the counter from previous reviews then I would have been really confused walking in on how to order.  The counter you order at just looks like the side of the bar. I ordered a fish taco, veggie taco, and chips and salsa/guac. The fish taco was yummy, good flavor and a nice crunch on the fish, the veggie taco was just okay. The veggie taco didn't have a ton of texture, just soft zucchini, beans, and pico, also they put arugula on it and it gave it a weird taste and again a soft texture that I really didn't like. The salsa was great but they all come in very small plastic cups and the portions are small. Would be hard to share with two people if both are fans of guac as the portion is teeny tiny. Nothing really special with those expect the guac was nice and chunky! With both tacos being 3-4 dollars I really expected more. Cute place with a lot of potential but as of now I wouldn't go back.

cOIpAo0_ZcOvLEY3JV70vA.text: Food and service are amazing! Favorite Mexican place by far. Kitty and Adrian are awesome!

PqAyBstFjqYS3UK1FbBt9A.text: I'm sure this establishment means well and they have a concept. But it's really sad to see how much revenue they are losing by making people get in line for food and then for drinks. That's just a horrible way to run a bar/restaurant. The food is alright. The quesadilla was my favorite. But the meat needs some work because it tastes really cheap. Only one bartender, and he can't keep up. There were only 4 people at the bar.  The concept and place are cute. But their food is a 2 or 3 for the price.

sOPuRunyKLzscsUIyGlbPA.text: Best Tacos I have had in a good while. As soon as you touch the golden tortilla you can tell it's going to be good. The density! The texture! It's outstanding. It's not until you take the first bite and you get a burst of corn sensation that you realize you have underestimated the tortilla. Then the taco filling comes. It doesn't matter what filling you get the flavors are exquisitely developed. If you have the room, order the Frijoles a la Charra. It's a hearty pinto and bacon stew with well developed flavors and plenty of depth to go around, especially if you add the carnitas to it.

aKtwwUJrbryRlPE9fz5GFw.text: Very good tacos .. cozy little place in the heart of Phoenix ..really enjoyed our evening there ..

TPAdiHHtfhZ60suQnWeHqA.text: Top notch tacos! Looks family owned and a cute little old lady is hand making all the tortillas! Really fresh, great flavors. All the stewed meats are to die for. Great guac and mixed drinks!

jc10khp44PqJz7lcnxGR7g.text: Looking for something to eat walking distance from my hotel. This place is awesome! Simple menu with delicious options. The guacamole is some of the best I've ever had. I think I'll b back tomorrow.

kVve55ybNxNd4D67HDv-Lw.text: This is exactly what downtown needs! Such a cool taco shop with absolutely exquisite decor. It is order at the counter which I typically have a real aversion to, but after I ate, I couldn't hate on it because my food was so gooooood! We ordered tacos, chicharrones and horchata. The menu isn't big, but what was served was really delicious. I'm still thinking of the horchata, and it was the best I've had in a really long time, maybe ever. There were two things that I'd like to make note of, and they are the reason for minus two stars. First, some customers brought a dog into the restaurant, like actually inside. The employees were petting the dog and they were allowed to sit at their table inside the restaurant with the dog while they ate. Now, this was clearly not a service animal, and I don't even need to tell you how the Maricopa County Environmental Services Department feels about this. Big no no for me, I do not need pets where I eat my food. Secondly, the prices are pretty high! For our above mentioned food, we spent over $40. At $3.50 a taco, it adds up quick. There are a lot of good taco options in Phoenix that don't charge near as much, I was a little turned off.

frjqrKy6oBYGmHiF7v-Dfg.text: Excited to come try this place but no one picked up the phone.  We called 3 days in a row.

nms3DFmlcj6IfMfBu46MMA.text: Went to lunch at Taco Chelo. The food was excellent and their signature beer was really good, but I felt the price was a little high. But that would not deter me from going back.

Eapoi6nL1MC4-NY7ac_MEw.text: We tried this place for the first time and it was just average in my opinion. The atmosphere is great and the decor is nice. The food...is very average. The fish taco and barbacoa were the only good ones. The carne asada meat was super fatty and super salty. The guacamole and chips were delicious as well. We got the jamica drink and it had no flavor what so ever. The lemonade drink was ok.

q8Mi4wRg-04mmFwt8uv5_w.text: Four stars, date. Great atmosphere but not a lot of flavor in the fish tacos. The Carnitas however were tasty, so perhaps we missed out. Price is reasonable, and the chips and guacamole were good. The salsa was great!

WSCg4fOpFx-ELdALyNYXbg.text: This place is very mediocre, unless grabbing drinks and you're looking for a bar. The tacos and quesadillas are very small and overpriced.

4fiVrn7uwYzGAJzwx-3Ctw.text: I'm glad I found this place! It's my new favorite Mexican restaurant in the downtown area. Great service, delicious food, and a solid drink menu. The staff has always been friendly and great a recommending drinks (*cough* Adrian *cough*). I've been a few times now and will definitely be back!

oVKvPKPndX7eqfYyVk8QOQ.text: This was my first time I have been to Taco Chelo.  I decided to give your restaurant a try while dining in the neighborhood. I was excited to see that you had chicharrones on the menu but much to my surprise the chicharrones were not crispy or crunchy.  They looked to be days or months old being stored in a plastic container that I could see while I was dining.  Maybe you should try to cook them, when they are asked for instead of cooking them in the morning or mid shift & storing them in the container.  I could have got more crunch from a bag of chicharrones from the circle k. They were crunchless, tough to chew & had no flavor despite the cheese, guacamole & hot sauce served with it.  Recommendation, fry them up as needed & clean your floors & tables before seating your next customers.  Lastly, you definitely need to make sure & check your carnitas more thoroughly.  I found two bones in my tacos, you might want to invest in dental insurance for your patrons.

qRbpXs5kZl4-OOzxi_IWtA.text: My wife and I were there yesterday for the second time in a week. The tacos are a 6.5 out of 10 the quesadillas however are really good. We are seat at the bar people so we enjoyed the ambiance and my wife loves the pastel de 3 leches. Tortillas are great and salsas are good as well, the best part of our experience however was our bartender (Jose) He was friendly, attentive and extremely cordial. Thx Jose!
